title: User Registration with Email and Password Setup
description: Verify that a user can successfully register an account using email and password, with optional MFA or passkey setup.

steps.description: Navigate to the registration page.
Enter a valid email address.
Create and enter a strong master password.
Optionally set up MFA with TOTP or SMS.
Optionally register a passkey for passwordless authentication.
Submit the registration form.
Check that registration is successful and user is redirected to the onboarding or dashboard page.
Verify that no plaintext password is sent to the server by inspecting the network requests.

title: Login with Password and TOTP Multi-Factor Authentication
description: Verify that user login using email and password with TOTP-based MFA is successful and enforces zero-knowledge authentication.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Input valid registered email and password.
Submit login credentials.
Verify that server challenges for TOTP MFA.
Input valid TOTP code.
Submit TOTP code.
Verify successful login and access to encrypted vault data.
Ensure no master password or encryption keys are transmitted in plaintext.

title: Passwordless Login using WebAuthn Passkey with Biometric Authentication
description: Test successful passwordless login using registered WebAuthn passkey including biometric factor validation.

steps.description: Navigate to login page.
Choose passwordless WebAuthn login option.
Trigger passkey authentication prompt.
Complete biometric verification (e.g., fingerprint or face recognition).
Verify login is successful and vault data is decrypted client-side.
Confirm no passwords are requested or transmitted during this flow.

title: OAuth Social Login Flow with Google Provider
description: Verify that logging in using OAuth via Google is successful and enforces any required MFA policies.

steps.description: Navigate to login page.
Click on Google social login button.
Complete OAuth consent and authentication via Google.
Verify user is logged in and redirected appropriately.
Ensure subsequent MFA is enforced as per application policy.
Check that the server only receives authentication tokens and no plaintext passwords.

title: Master Password Key Derivation and Encryption Key Generation
description: Confirm that master password is processed on the client using Argon2id KDF to generate encryption keys and a zero-knowledge hash is sent to server.

steps.description: Enter master password on client.
Verify Argon2id KDF runs locally generating encryption keys.
Check that only zero-knowledge hashed credentials are sent to server.
Ensure no plaintext master password or encryption keys leave client.

title: Vault Item CRUD Operations with Client-Side Encryption
description: Test creating, reading, updating, and deleting vault items ensuring AES-256-GCM encryption is performed client-side before server transmission.

steps.description: Create a new vault item (e.g., password entry) with all required fields.
Verify item data is encrypted using AES-256-GCM client-side before sending to server.
View the created vault item.
Verify encrypted data is decrypted client-side and shown correctly.
Update the vault item with new data.
Verify updated data is re-encrypted client-side and sent.
Delete the vault item.
Confirm the item is removed and no plaintext data remains on server.

title: Password Generator Produces Secure and Strong Passwords with ML Feedback
description: Verify the password generator creates cryptographically secure passwords with user-selected options and ML strength feedback is properly displayed.

steps.description: Open the password generator.
Select password criteria: length, character sets, complexity.
Generate a password.
Confirm password meets selected criteria.
Verify ML-powered strength meter displays password strength in real-time.
Check generated passwords use secure randomness.

title: Post-Quantum Cryptography Operations Using CRYSTALS-Kyber-768 Hybrid
description: Test correct encryption and decryption using post-quantum hybrid cryptographic algorithms with performance benchmarking.

steps.description: Trigger client-side encryption of sensitive data using Kyber-768 hybrid scheme.
Verify encryption completes successfully within expected performance benchmarks.
Perform decryption of the encrypted data on client.
Confirm decrypted data matches original plaintext.
Confirm performance speedup meets or exceeds 6x baseline for Kyber operations.

title: Fully Homomorphic Encryption for Encrypted Password Strength Checks
description: Verify that encrypted password strength checks using multi-tier FHE complete successfully and results are accurate with caching optimization.

steps.description: Submit encrypted password data for server-side FHE computation.
Verify server performs encrypted operations correctly without data exposure.
Confirm that FHE results are accurately returned and interpreted client-side.
Test caching layers improve response times according to expected performance.

title: Real-Time Breach Alert via Dark Web Monitoring
description: Confirm that the system receives and displays real-time breach alerts leveraging WebSocket connections and ML models.

steps.description: Establish WebSocket connection to breach monitoring service.
Verify breach alerts are received in real-time when detected.
Check that breach alerts trigger immediate notification updates in security dashboard.
Validate that ML models (BERT & Siamese networks) correctly classify threat severity.

title: Behavioral DNA Capture and Recovery Verification
description: Test capturing 247-dimensional behavioral biometrics for continuous authentication and recovery approval process.

steps.description: Perform typing challenge capturing keystroke dynamics.
Complete mouse interaction challenge capturing mouse biometrics.
Engage cognitive pattern challenge.
Verify data captured matches expected format and dimensionality.
Submit behavioral data for recovery verification.
Confirm that recovery approval triggers only if behavioral thresholds are met.

title: Session Auto-Lock and Device Trust Management
description: Verify session auto-lock triggers key clearance after inactivity and device trust scoring is properly enforced with audit logging.

steps.description: Log into account and remain inactive until auto-lock timeout.
Check that encryption keys are wiped from client memory upon auto-lock.
Access session and device management page.
Review device trust scores and toggle trust settings.
Verify audit logs record changes and access events accurately.

title: Shared Folder Management with Role-Based Access Control
description: Test creating, sharing, and managing folders with role-based access and invitations for team collaboration.

steps.description: Create a new shared folder.
Add vault items to the shared folder.
Invite team members with assigned roles (viewer, editor, admin).
Verify invited users receive invitation and can access shared folder according to assigned permissions.
Change roles and revoke access.
Confirm permissions update immediately and revoked users lose access.

title: Vault Data Synchronization Across Web, Mobile, Desktop, and Browser Extensions
description: Verify seamless synchronization of encrypted vault data across all supported platforms with consistent UI and behavior.

steps.description: Log in on web client and create/update vault items.
Log in on desktop and mobile clients.
Verify vault updates are synchronized and decrypted correctly on all clients.
Confirm consistent UX and encryption handling across platforms.

title: Encrypted Vault Export and Import Functionality
description: Test exporting vault backup as encrypted blob and importing it back securely restores vault data.

steps.description: Trigger vault export generating encrypted backup file.
Verify exported file is encrypted and cannot be read without master keys.
Import vault backup file back into vault.
Confirm vault data is restored completely and correctly.

title: Error Handling for Invalid Credentials and Network Failures
description: Verify that the system appropriately handles invalid login attempts and recovers gracefully from network issues.

steps.description: Attempt login with incorrect email format.
Verify validation error message is shown and submission blocked.
Attempt login with invalid password.
Verify login failure message without revealing sensitive info.
Simulate network disconnection during login.
Verify appropriate network error message is displayed.
Retry login after network restoration.
Confirm login proceeds successfully after recovery.

title: Guardians-Based Social Mesh Recovery Workflow
description: Test initiating and completing social mesh recovery with guardian invitations and temporal challenge responses.

steps.description: Initiate social mesh recovery after losing access.
Send invitations to trusted guardians.
Verify guardians receive and acknowledge recovery requests.
Respond to temporal multi-day recovery challenges.
Confirm recovery proceeds only after required approvals and waiting periods.

title: Security Dashboard Breach Alerts and Device Management
description: Validate that the security dashboard updates with breach alerts and allows management of device sessions and emergency access.

steps.description: Trigger a breach alert event.
Verify real-time alert appears on security dashboard.
Navigate to device management, review active sessions.
Deactivate a device session.
Confirm session termination and audit log update.
Initiate emergency access request with trusted contacts.
Verify emergency access waits appropriate time and notifications.

title: API Endpoint Verifies Encrypted Blob Handling and Metadata Only Queries
description: Test that API endpoints return encrypted vault blobs and properly support faster metadata-only queries without exposing ciphertext.

steps.description: Request full vault item from API.
Confirm encrypted blob data is returned with no plaintext.
Request metadata-only list of vault items.
Verify response contains only metadata without ciphertext for performance.

title: Performance Benchmark: Cache Hit Rate and API Latency Improvements
description: Validate multi-level caching (L1 memory, L2 Redis, DB caching) combined with response compression achieves expected performance gains.

steps.description: Execute a series of common vault API requests repeatedly.
Verify cache hit rate is at least 10x better than baseline without cache.
Confirm API response times improve by at least 10x due to caching and compression.
Validate integrity and correctness of compressed responses.
